intro: Alpinia kiungensis, commonly known as the Guangxi ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, leafy stems and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Alpinia kiungensis thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas.
